wikipedia_page.main: Thomas John Davis (born c. 1901; date of death unknown) was an English footballer who played at centre-half for Port Vale and Stafford Rangers in the 1920s.

response: * Tom Davis (Virginia politician) (born 1949), U.S. Representative from Virginia
* Tom Davis (South Carolina politician) (born 1960), South Carolina State Senator for Beaufort County
* Tom Davis (handcyclist) (born 1977), American Paralympian, 2016 Rio Paralympics
* Tom Davis (basketball coach) (born 1938), American college basketball coach
* Tom Davis (basketball player) (born c. 1970), American college basketball player
* Tom Davis (footballer, born 1901) (1901–?), English association footballer
* Tom Davis (footballer, born 1911) (1911–1987), Irish association footballer
* Tom Davis (rugby union) (c. 1894–?), rugby union player who represented Australia
* Tom Davis (comedian) (1952–2012), American comedy writer on Saturday Night Live
* Tom Davis (British actor) (born 1979), comedian and actor

Upon his retirement he became a keen Port Vale fan; he co-founded the club's Ex-Players Association with former teammate Ken Hancock. He worked as a motor mechanic. He married Pat, who was named as Miss Port Vale 1954. He had two sons: Greg and Duncan; and two grandchildren: Reece Poole and Katie Poole. His uncle, Tom Davis, also played for Port Vale in the 1920s. Poole's death was announced by Port Vale on 19 November 2020.
